Token.Abstract: A tilemap node renders a TMX tilemap. It has KKTilemapTileLayerNode and KKTilempaObjectLayerNode as children which perform each layer's rendering.
the tilemap model object containing the tilemap's data.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the tilemap model object containing the tilemap's data.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the tilemap model object containing the tilemap's data.

ReturnValue.Abstract: the tilemap model object containing the tilemap's data.

Token.Abstract: The tilemap's bounds rect in points. The x/width and/or y/height are set to INFINITY if the main layer is set to endless scrolling (horizontal or vertical).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tilemap's bounds rect in points. The x/width and/or y/height are set to INFINITY if the main layer is set to endless scrolling (horizontal or vertical).

Token.Abstract: The tilemap's bounds rect in points. The x/width and/or y/height are set to INFINITY if the main layer is set to endless scrolling (horizontal or vertical).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tilemap's bounds rect in points. The x/width and/or y/height are set to INFINITY if the main layer is set to endless scrolling (horizontal or vertical).

Token.Abstract: The tilemap's bounds rect in points. The x/width and/or y/height are set to INFINITY if the main layer is set to endless scrolling (horizontal or vertical).

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tilemap's bounds rect in points. The x/width and/or y/height are set to INFINITY if the main layer is set to endless scrolling (horizontal or vertical).

Token.Abstract: The main layer in a parallaxing tilemap is the layer with a parallax ratio of 1.0f. Otherwise it's the first tile layer.
The main layer in a parallaxing tilemap is the layer with a parallax ratio of 1.0f. Otherwise it's the first tile layer.
The main layer in a parallaxing tilemap is the layer with a parallax ratio of 1.0f. Otherwise it's the first tile layer.
The game object layer is the object layer where (most) game objects reside. Usually the layer that scrolls parallel to the main tile layer.
The game object layer is the object layer where (most) game objects reside. Usually the layer that scrolls parallel to the main tile layer.
The game object layer is the object layer where (most) game objects reside. Usually the layer that scrolls parallel to the main tile layer.
Creates a tilemap node from a TMX file.

Parameter.Name: tmxFile
Parameter.Abstract: The filename of a TMX file in the bundle or an absolute path to a TMX file.

Token.Abstract: The name identifying a tile layer.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name identifying a tile layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The tile layer node with the name, or nil if there's no tile layer with that name.

Token.Abstract: The name identifying an object layer.

Parameter.Name: name
Parameter.Abstract: The name identifying an object layer.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The object layer node with the name, or nil if there's no object layer with that name.

Token.Abstract: Searches all object layers for an object with a matching name.

ReturnValue.Abstract: The first object (of any object layer) with a matching name, or nil if no such object exists.

Token.Abstract: Enables boundary scrolling. This prevents the map's main tile layer from ever scrolling outside its bounds.
Enables parallax scrolling which makes other layers follow the main tile layer's position with parallax offset. Call this after setting up any camera follow object.
